title: New York City’s Jail-Reform Architect Looks to Norway for Ideas
text:
Senior officials behind New York City’s sweeping criminal-justice overhaul are visiting jails in Norway—regarded by some as among the most humane in the world—with an eye toward bringing back lessons in incarceration from cutting-edge prisons there.

The trips were the idea of Elizabeth Glazer, who as the director of the Mayor’s Office of Criminal Justice is leading some of the nation’s most aggressive criminal-justice overhauls in New York City, including a plan to close the Rikers Island jail complex and replace it with four...
